notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform release 3.11.161 is now available with
updates to packages and images that fix several bugs and add enhancements.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

This advisory contains the RPM packages for Red Hat OpenShift Container
Platform 3.11.161. See the following advisory for the container images for
this release:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2020:0018

This release fixes the following bugs:

* In the openshift-logging update using Ansible, if a new value was set in the inventory file to apply the change to the existing cluster, the change was ignored. This occurred because the module logging_patch accidentally created a patch to change a new file into the original file. The patching direction was fixed and the changes made in an inventory file are now correctly applied. (BZ#1753593)

* When the SDN pod was restarted on a node, it did not clean up any old Egress IP addresses. If the set of Egress IP addresses assigned to a node changed while the SDN pod was not running, then the node might continue to claim that it owned the Egress IP even after the IP had been assigned to another node. This caused traffic to that IP to be delivered to the wrong node and be lost. The SDN pod now cleans up stale Egress IP addresses at startup. (BZ#1762235)

* SDN code would declare each node as READY before the SDN proxy was completely initialized. Some iptables rules would not be populated and the node is marked as ready. This caused some pods to not be able to communicate with the API while coming up. Now, all iptables rules exist before pods get schedules to the node, preventing issues where pod's cannot communicate with the API server. (BZ#1764150)

This release includes the following enhancements: 

* The latest Kuryr images are now hosted in Red Hat's registry. (BZ#1652571)

All OpenShift Container Platform 3.11 users are advised to upgrade to these
updated packages and images.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 3.11 bug fix and enhancement update

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: In Jenkins 2.196 and earlier, LTS 2.176.3 and earlier, the f:expandableTextBox form control interpreted its content as HTML when expanded, resulting in a stored XSS vulnerability exploitable by users with permission to define its contents (typically Job/Configure).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins: Stored XSS vulnerability in expandable textbox form control
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, ensure all previously released errata relevant
to your system is applied.

See the following documentation, which will be updated shortly for release
3.11.161, for important instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/release_notes/ocp_3_11_release_notes.html

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the
Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258.

vulnerabilities.title: jenkins: Stored XSS vulnerability in expandable textbox form control

notes.text: In Jenkins 2.196 and earlier, LTS 2.176.3 and earlier, the f:combobox form control interpreted its item labels as HTML, resulting in a stored XSS vulnerability exploitable by users with permission to define its contents.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins: XSS vulnerability in combobox form control
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: Jenkins 2.196 and earlier, LTS 2.176.3 and earlier did not escape the SCM tag name on the tooltip for SCM tag actions, resulting in a stored XSS vulnerability exploitable by users able to control SCM tag names for these actions.

notes.text: Jenkins 2.196 and earlier, LTS 2.176.3 and earlier did not escape the reason why a queue items is blcoked in tooltips, resulting in a stored XSS vulnerability exploitable by users able to control parts of the reason a queue item is blocked, such as label expressions not matching any idle executors.

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: Jenkins 2.196 and earlier, LTS 2.176.3 and earlier printed the value of the "Cookie" HTTP request header on the /whoAmI/ URL, allowing attackers exploiting another XSS vulnerability to obtain the HTTP session cookie despite it being marked HttpOnly.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Jenkins 2.196 and earlier, LTS 2.176.3 and earlier did not restrict or filter values set as Jenkins URL in the global configuration, resulting in a stored XSS vulnerability exploitable by attackers with Overall/Administer permission.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
